description:
Great spot for quality and inventive sushi at a good price point.

I've visited 3 times and I've never had to wait for a table. The service is usually very friendly and our water glasses never go half empty. The tables aren't super close together, and the restaurant doesn't get too loud.

As for food, I love the butterfish nachos and the smashing pumpkin roll. Their rolls are pretty filling... I usually only get the edamame, nachos, and 2 rolls with a dining companion. 

Would definitely recommend for a casual night out!
author: Roya B.

description:
Decent service but bad sushi...

I wanted to like Hot Zushi... came in on a friday evening, looking to grab some decent sushi without a long wait. Read great reviews on yelp and got excited!

So I take my seat, not much décor... oh well, I'm here for the fish! I look at the menu, wow... it's pretty big, they have a wide selection! Awesome!!! They have sushi, nigiri, rolls, handrolls, several specialty dishes, menu looks great! And I am hungry... my stomach is ready!!! 

But when the food came... I was pretty disappointed... I wanted to like this place... but... I just can't...

Butterfish Nachos
This was actually not a bad dish! The wonton chips were crispy and the salsa had a lot of flavor. My only and biggest gripe is that things didn't seem that fresh. I know it's hard to not prep things ahead of time... but the salsa seemed like it was sitting there since yesterday...

Japanese Hamachi Sashimi
Way over-seasoned, it felt like the sauce was overpowering the fish, the dish was basically salty sauce with some fish texture... Do not order...

Crunchy Sake
This roll was literally just thin slices of salmon over rice with thinly and overly-fried potato in the middle, so there was some fish at top, then it was so so so.... dry in the center... 

Seasonal Nigiri Tasting
The fish wasn't well cut, there were several tears in our pieces... I'm not sure if that's due to the quality of the fish or the chef but either way... not great...

Three Amigos
This type of roll was actually what I was expecting, nothing great, but would still love to eat! If you come here, get this!

I know this review differs a lot from the other reviews for Hot Zuzhi... perhaps this place just isn't my cup o' tea or I really ordered the wrong stuff...not sure what happened... but didn't even seem like a bad night for them.

I just can't recommend this place and wouldn't go back even if someone wanted to go... so that's why the 2 stars...

Hope I'm wrong on this though.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is my go-to middle of the line sushi place (you can't splurge on Kusakabe every day lol), and honestly it is AMAZING. For the price, the quality of fish is consistently good, always fresh, and good portions. Try the sake kale roll or negi toro. Soooo good!

Happy hour deals are solid and seriously worth it -- discounted hand rolls, sake, and Sapporo

The back booth can get loud and rowdy (think sake bombs), so don't expect a quiet evening every time.  It can also get pretty crowded, there's maybe 8 tables, but the host Connie is always sweet and accommodating. LOVE YOU CONNIE!!
author: Maddy H.

description: Missing this place dearly since departing the city. A true gem hidden in the Lower haight with the nicest people, crunchy sake rolls, and amazing blue fin toro (mmm the oily fatty stuff). We will be back as often as we can!!!
author: Brian D.

description:
Stumbled upon Hot Zushi on a random Friday night.. one of the few places with no wait!

This review is based on having one sushi roll, the udon, and the ramen. We ordered the 3 amigos roll... which was less than $10 and sooo generously portioned. 5 pieces that were filled with huge chunks of raw fish. Yum! The udon and ramen were cheaper than any other place I've been to SF. It's definitely work the $10-11, but I would probably recommend a real ramen/udon place instead of a sushi restaurant. A whole (nice) meal in SF for under $30... can't go wrong :)

Parking was surprisingly easy. It's free street parking after 6 right out front.

5 stars for the sushi roll and fast and very friendly service!
author: Michelle N.

description: Went there around 8:20 pm tonight, they had a very bad sign in board which u literally just put ur name down, but when ppl r seated, they never came to update the board so everyone was super confused. After we sat down it took them a long time to bring the menu and then the food over, by the food was reallllly good. My absolutely favorite is the spider roll, it is so crunchy , so warm and soooooo delicious. I also like their grilled whole calamari, it is super good and I love it with aioli. Last time we visited we got delicious roll and smashing pumpkin, we liked it then but this time when I tried the delicious roll, it wasn't good at all. It is really easy to fall apart and I was really disappointed.
author: Shuang W.

description: Finally, an affordable and high quality sushi place in San Francisco! And we were pleasantly surprised to see a happy hour (5-7pm) there too. We got 3 rolls, grilled salmon with ponzu sauce, and the butterfish nachos which was more than enough for 2 people. Service was really attentive. The rolls were a really good size and the fish tasted fresh. I highly recommend this spot.
author: Emma W.

description: Good quality, reasonable prices. Really enjoyed the baked crab roll. Prices were standard for SF, but not bad for Sushi. We'll be back.
author: Seth C.

description: This review is for August 31st at 8:42 P.M: So I know it was the end of the night already, but the Spicy Tuna was pretty "fishy" according to my cousin; I'm not usually one to say this, because I hate it when people say "fish" is too "fishy." When I was a server I would want to say to the customer who would return a fish or seafood platter, "Uh what did you expect, you're getting fish!!" But, on this occasion, I was able to grasp what this expression truly meant. Spicy tuna, "It's a no from me." Service wasn't too keen either.
author: Evin S.

description:
If you're looking for the best sushi in SF, you won't get it here.

If you're looking for awesome sushi at an awesome price point, you will get it here. Specialty rolls run from something like $9-$14, and they're all really good. The Three Amigos and Dragon roll were super good. We also ordered the a nigiri sampler(?), which is I think 8 pieces for $18. I really liked the variety they gave, and each piece was really good. There's also generic rolls for like $6.

Did I mention there's a happy hour? 5:30pm-7:00pm every day. Weekends included. $3.50 Large Sapporo and $3.50 large house sake. Hand rolls for $3.25, and a discounted selection of appetizers too.

I didn't expect too much from a place called Hot Zushi, but you get good quality and quantity for the price. Sushi is great, hand rolls are awesome, and drinks are cheap.
author: Brandon L.

description:
I went here last night before a show at the Independent. This is a very low key eatery that doesn't look like it would be remarkable but their butter fish nachos are truest unique and delicious.  I almost did t order them because I'm usually not that adventurous with my sushi orders, regardless of the place. But since it was happy hour they had two pieces for $4, which is pretty good so we added some to our order and it was my favorite part of the meal.  The mango lobster roll was also a close second, it also had macadamia nuts in it which made it very unique. 
If I'm ever in the area again, I will Seinfeld be coming back for the butterfish nachos
author: Josie C.

description:
I went here for my cousin's birthday dinner and I would say this is a pretty unique sushi joint! Of course there's the standard rolls like the Dragon Roll, California Roll, etc., but there were also lots of unique combinations that I would've never expected to taste so yummy! 

We ordered a whole bunch of different rolls to try and I'd have to say the Beastie Bacon Roll was the best. I'm not a huge fan of seafood, but the combo of bacon and scallops was just sooo delish! Also, this place uses real crab for all the rolls, so you can tell that it's definitely legit here. Everyone ended up finishing all the food, which means this place was a  great choice for dinner! :D
author: Christine D.

description: My favorite sushi spot in SF. Their nigiri is unreal, especially for the price. Uni is amazing, so are their hamachi and sake toros. We come here and order a bunch of nigiri and leave satisfied.
author: Stephanie T.

description: One of our favorite sushi spots in sf. We usually go to toronado next store for beer, then head here for delicious dinner. They have great rolls and great appetizers. Very reasonably priced, and a friendly and attentive staff. Definitely recommend checking this place out!
author: Mollie H.

description: Each time I come here, I try to get at least one new thing to try and I'm always blown away. My favourites are the Negi Toro and the Delicious, I try to order one or the other every time I visit. During happy hour, you can get a Sapporo for 3.50, this is a great place to have a chill early dinner and kick back. My only complaint is that it can get very noisy when it's busy, but overall a great experience!
author: Caelin J.

description: Creative, fresh, and priced very well.  Mango Lobster roll was stuffed with chunks of lobster and the macadamia nuts and cilantro was a nice contrast in texture and flavor. Sake Kirota was a carb-free salmon delight, was really interesting with the non-seaweed wrap (kinda like a spring roll). And no need for any soy sauce on the Tuna Tataki, slices of albacore and onion with a bright ponzu taste.
author: Josel S.

description:
Hot Zushi is my favorite cheap sushi place!! I'm a lazy AF person that won't usually walk 6 blocks (i'll drive it LOL), but I will go there to get my sushi. I have their menu on my fridge and I am terrified of the day they close. I say that because every time my boyfriend and I go to the restaurant, it's pretty empty :( At most 3 other tables are occupied during prime time dinner time. 

With that! You'll never have a hard time for seating, their menu is great and very affordable, their takeout is within 20 min, and the owners are very attentive and nice :D

Bf and I have tried most of the rolls on their menu and here are our faves: hamachi line ($6), monkey ($6.5), rock & roll ($5.5), sake avocado ($5.5), spicy tuna ($5.5). Most classic rolls are 6 pieces, a few are 5 pieces.
Their most expensive specialty roll is $14, so that should put their pricing into perspective. 

I will continue to come here at least once every 3 weeks forever.
author: Barbara C.

description:
Great Sushi place.

Very reasonable prices and good portion side.

I have dined in and ordered pickup and both had flawless service.

I am so happy this place is right near my house.

Oh and I cannot wait to try out the happy hour.
author: Nick C.

description: This place is easily my go-to for sushi in my neighborhood. The service is fantastic, the food is amazing, and the prices are pretty reasonable. The rolls are yummy and the fish is always super fresh and tasty. They have a basic beer and wine selection but the corkage is only $10 if you're into bringing your own. I've hesitated reviewing this place because I'm selfish and want it all to myself but it's too good not to share.
author: Margot L.

description: Great value and service. Happy hour is from 5:30-7:00pm even on weekends and is a great way to save money. We started out with some $2 miso soup,  then got some potato pancakes and edamame off the happy hour menu. We also got some mixed Tempura which was good, but a little too oily and fried for my tastes. We then ended the meal with some $3 hand rolls. Overall our two person bill came out to less than $30 which is pretty good compared to other places. However everything here is pretty salty so keep that in mind before ordering. I'd definitely come back again especially for happy hour.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Great food, not impressive environment.

Very unique rolls and sushi.

Worthy to come and ask for suggestions!
author: Mauro P.

description:
Overall this place is good if you want a quick bite and not wait for hours! There are always tables available, which is rare especially on Friday nights. Also the quality food is pretty decent for the price! 

Service: good

Food: the best thing to get here is the crab hadroll ! It was creamy, crispy and flavorful! 

We also ordered:
- hamachi Kama: too peppery 
- uni nigiri : not to much flavor but ok for the price!
- tres amigos roll: it was ok
- sashimi : not a lot of flavor but fresh
author: Mily W.

description:
You will not find a spicier bowl of ramen. Wow! What a delicious and intense dish. I almost always think the spice of a "spicy"  at a ramen spot is underwhelming. Not here! Such a rich broth with delightful burn. I underestimated it because the toppings are light, but didn't think for a second Ankur that once I dove in. Very nice touch with the spinach as well. Usually get seaweed and sometimes find it can be a bit out of place, whereas the spinach was a simple but filling touch.

I'm coming back to try the Jon spicy. I think that brother has a ton of potential. 

Noodles where slightly more cooked than I like. But rather that than undercooked.
author: Devon W.

description:
I seriously wished I lived in the neighborhood. I can't believe some people just get to walk to this place from their apartment. 

The dish that stood out was the Butterfish Nachos $10. I thought it was a fair price. While I Iove traditional style sushi, I like trying out something new. Fusion is okay as long as it's well executed. I'm a tiny bit wary of "butterfish" otherwise know as " escolar" or "white tuna." But as long as you don't have digestive issues, you'll probably be fine if you consume it in moderation. It was crunchy, sweet, and spicy.  

The salmon tartar $2, nigiri tasting $18, hotate nigiri $5, and uni nigiri $7 were all delightful.

They have a special secret dish the "salmon tartar" that is served on top of a fried shiso leaf. Ask for it. I couldn't find it on the menu. But I saw someone else's yelp photo. Yay yelp!

This was the first sushi place in SF we tried since moving back to the west coast - I am really glad we chose Hot Zushi. The staff was very sweet. At the end of our meal, they asked if we lived in the neighborhood. Sadly, we do not - but we hope those that do check this place out.
author: Thien H.

description:
Visited Hot Zushi because it is close to where I live in SF. From the outside, I did not really expect the food from this place. However, after trying their dinner, I have to say this is a really good Japanese restaurant if you are craving for some sushi rolls.

I recommend you to go during Happy Hour because they offer really good deal such as $5 soba noodles and $3 beer. I also like to get their $4 Butterfish Nachos during happy hour. Love how they prepare the nachos--fresh fish drizzled with some citrus and ponzu sauce. REALLY YUMMY and LIGHT.

Yesterday, I tried their grilled beef short ribs for the first time. Surprisingly, for $11, they gave us a big plate of meat. If it were in a Korean restaurant, this amount is usually cost ~$20-22. 

As for their sushi rolls, I love their Dragon Rolls. Besides nice plating, the unagi and avocado are usually fresh and with the housemade unagi sauce, it has become a must order for my boyfriend and me. We have also tried Spider rolls and Beastie Bacon. Both are pretty good. I guess from my multiple times of visit, as long as you order rolls, you won't get disappointed.

Besides rolls, I highly recommend their soba noodles. The noodles are cooked well and the dipping sauce is amazing. I am not usually a big noodle fan but Hot Zushi does a great job making their noodle dish.
author: Clare L.

description:
Neighborhood vibes. Nice nigiri. Sweet staff. And the rollzzzzzz  
Our go-to spot now.
author: Juls M.

description: Thoroughly standard sushi restaurant from the bland decor and ambiance to the standard menu and quality of the fish. This is a straightforward place for a standard roll but would not be worth going out of your way to try.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Hot zushi is my go to spot. I've made it a point to try out as many different sushi spots in the city as possible, but I find myself a repeat customer here. The Sake Kale roll is life changing.

All of their sushi is super fresh, the staff is unbelievably kind, and the happy hour is a steal. House sake and hand rolls for 3 dollars. This neighborhood spot is a true gem, and can't be beat for its quality and affordability!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Super cheap and affordable sushi with excellent happy hour specials!!  Happy hour everyday which includes deals on hand rolls ($3) and also $3 for a large Asahi or Sapporo (21 oz) or for a large house sake.

We ordered a few rolls.  They have some really unique ones.  I wasn't in love with all of the rolls--definitely not the highest of quality but really fantastic at the price point.  The two rolls that we really liked though were the Crunchy Sake and the Shibui.
- The Shibui Roll is like the Smashing Pumpkin (pumpkin tempura) but also has some delicious albacore & avocado on top.  Because really, whoever invented pumpkin tempura is a genius!
- The Crunchy Sake Roll has fried potato flakes rolled up with salmon and the thinnest slice of lemon you've ever seen rolled into the salmon.  It was a really unique combination: the lemon highlighted the salmon flavor and the potato bits added a nice crunch to the roll.

I would definitely come back during Happy Hour and I would totally reorder the Shibui and the Crunchy Sake Roll!  This is the most affordable sushi place in SF that I've found!  Great service as well--really nice people and they were very attentive.
author: Jess Y.

description: Excellent selection of rolls and the staff was very helpful. Definitely will be coming back here. I highly recommend the Buddha roll if you're a vegetarian!
author: Mayuri P.

description:
This place is such a hidden gem! The service is pretty slow but the food was great! 

We started with the chili garlic edamame which was good but very spicy! We also go the wok green beans which were delicious.

All of the rolls we had were delicious but the Ozzy roll was my favorite! A little heavy on the spicy mayo but that was easy to scrape off.
author: Katharine P.

description:
The best sushi restaurant in the town. No question about it. The service was a as good as their sushis. 
Highly recommended place.
author: Madina Z.

description:
Was really hoping this could be a go to for me. Sounded too good to be true in terms of price. Here price does equate to quality. Fish was not very fresh. I think it's the first time I've never finished the nigiris I ordered. 

Service was great but can't make up for the fact that their stuff was mediocre.
author: Laura D.

description: I ordered pretty much all the happy hour specials, which were passable, but the special sushi rolls I got (Tres Amigos) were simply out of this world. If you're paying Hot Zushi a visit, I highly recommend focusing your order around their sushi roll creations.
author: Josh L.

description:
Great rolls for an affordable price! They have a good happy hour and the service was also attentive and friendly. Since it's small, I wouldn't recommend coming here with more than 4 people, but it's perfect for twos. 

It's also in a great location so you can explore bars afterwards!
author: Amanda K.

description:
David and Connie are the best, they could not be more welcoming and they definitely know how to make some terrific sushi. Especially delicious are the nigiri - very generous portions of high quality fish on perfectly cooked rice. The price is also super reasonable especially during happy hour (salmon skin hand rolls are a favorite). 

There are a bunch of sushi places in the neighborhood but this is far and away my favorite in the nieghborhood and in SF!
author: S L.

description: Mediocre but the prices are decent, though they are misleading. Portion sizes are small. Lots of good vegetarian options though, and service is quick. Drink specials are solid.
author: Janis E.

description: A 3.5 star review that I'm bumping up to a 4. All the offerings here are fairly fresh, whether the sushi, the sashimi platter, or some sushi rolls. The key thing here is that you get decent value and good-sized portions for the prices that you pay. Service is also fast and friendly. A nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Vincent L.

description: This is probably my favorite sushi spot in SF and lucky for us it's only a block away from our apartment. Great prices and high quality fish. I absolutely love the nigiri (we do chef's choice) - seriously on par with some higher end places I've been to in the city.  For rolls, our favorites are the Hamchi Lime and Shibui. The stellar food is also equally matched by the amazing service. Connie is extremely nice and always remembers our names. This truly feels like a local neighborhood spot. It's always a fun dining experience coming here and we always leave happy and full.
author: Sunitha N.

description: Good news folks, this place offers HH until 7pm!!! All you 9 to 5ers have plenty of time to stop by and have a roll or two paired with a ice cold Sapporo. That's $3 per handroll and make that another $3 for beer. My BF and I ordered four handrolls and one special roll. The handrolls included salmon skin roll, spicy tuna roll, and two rock and roll. All were tasty, but we especially enjoyed the salmon skin roll. Although this place offered an impressive selection of rolls, i've had better sushi rice elsewhere. Hence, why this place fell short from a 5 star review. The rice wasnt horrible, it just could have been better. Overall, a solid 4 star restaurant and I will find myself coming back sooner than later.
author: Briana H.

description: 90% of my eating out funds go toward eating sushi around the city, so I have favorites along the $ scale. Hot Zushi is my newest go-to for casual, mom 'n pop atmosphere and treatment. They're attentive enough and allow you space to enjoy. I love sitting at the little sushi bar with the friendly and down to earth chef (just one!). Food quality and presentation is excellent for the price point. Favorites include the Sake Kale Roll (yummy oily crispy fried kale with fresh salmon), albacore tataki (must love fresh onions), and Seasonal Nigiri tasting. Fun selection of veggie/vegan rolls, as well. Unassuming comfort sushi. Not the best if atmosphere is important to you, they're minimal and no frills.
author: Corinne R.

description: Visiting SF tonight and was looking for solid sushi without the crowds. This place didn't disappoint. Seemed like the local go to take out option. Petiole were coming in non stop for their pick up orders.
author: Dusty B.

description: Really really good sushi with a reasonable price!!!! The place is beautiful, the attention is impecable and the sushi delicious
author: Clarita C.

description:
Amazing vegetarian/vegan roll selection for a sushi spot! And they're all awesome! Reasonable prices, too.

Amazing service! One night they even gave us a free veggie roll that they were experimenting with :)
author: Jessica L.

description:
You may be thinking to yourself, "why is this place called 'Hot Zushi'? Is the sushi hot? Why would sushi be hot? Why would anyone spell 'sushi' with a 'Z?"

My friend, I am here to quell your concerns. The name of this restaurant is truly unfortunate, but the sushi is phenomenal. The nigiri is as fresh as any I've had this side of Japan. Prices are low for the quality, there's usually no wait for a table, and the waiters are friendly. I wholeheartedly endorse the Hot Zoosh for your next meal!
author: Chris B.

description:
It's with a heavy heart that I tell everyone how great this place is. Selfishly, I want to keep this gem close to the chest. But I know, this is the right thing to do. Where do I begin?

First, the service. This is the epitomy of a neighborhood restaurant. They remember us, welcome us, say bye to us like we're going to be missed. Every. Time. They remember what we like to order and joke when we deviate from the usual. For a neighborhood and space that turns over restaurants faster than you can say turn over, the people are really really stuck in my heart.

Second, the food. When I first heard the name of the new restaurant replacing raijin sushi, I thought ooohhhhh noooo, "hot zushi?" Don't let it fool you. The sushi is AMAZING. The fish taste top of the line. The chef sometimes surprises you with specials off the menu and they're a reminder of how much passion and love that go into the food. We've tried other mid range sushi places around to spice things up - tsunami, raw sushi, domo, otoro.. and they never live up to our beloved neighborhood gem.

The best things to order - victoria secret, escolar, anything the chef recommends.
author: Melanie S.

description:
Great sushi, servers are very helpful with recommendations on menu items, epic service. 

We'll be back. With friends.
author: Nuwan S.

description:
I'm so happy I found this neighborhood gem for some solid sushi rolls! I'm going to say right now if you are a sashimi or nigiri lover who is all about omakase sets, this place is not what you are looking for. But if you want yummy, solid sushi rolls and tasty apps, come on in!

I stopped in for a quick meal over the weekend and was delighted by how delicious everything was and felt everything was priced fairly (especially for Haight). I loved how fresh, bright, and flavorful the poke was. The juicy mangos really did it for me. I also really liked the Smashing Pumpkin roll which contained friend pumpkin tempura! There is not enough tempura pumpkin in my diet so I'll be making more frequent stops in here.

Aside from the TV screen to watch sports on and the sake and beer you can order, I'm not quite sure how this got categorized as a sports bar. It is definitely not a rowdy crowd.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
their happy hour was just epic, setting standards.
$3 large beers, $3 hand rolls, I got my unagi and my girl got her sake avocado.
Basically you want to stuff yourself full of the hand rolls and the beer.  There are other wonderful options as well and the service is sweet.  You should be able to bar-hop this block of lower haight somewhere before or after too, so location is dope if you like beers on tap.
The fish here was fresh and the folks way cool.  Come in here and get you SF sushi happy hour on.
author: S S.

description:
So I'm not one to write reviews but this place is worth it! It's probs my favorite sushi spot in the city. To start the service is incredible!! 5 stars just for that.  I work down the street and coworkers and I are there like once or twice a week, it's starting to become a problem, I guess there are worse vices...  We will take hot zushi over the other sushi spots in lower Haight any day. 

Ok let's get the to important part..the food!! Mmm. Apps are great, rolls are cool, but the star for me is the sashimi/nigiri. Always huge pieces and super fresh. The blue fin toro is heavenly. A normal order for us goes like this: (we like to eat, don't judge. Lol) gyoza, brussel sprouts, spicey green beans, hamachi sashimi Japanese style (my personal fav!) blue fin toro/hamachi toro/saba/unagi sashimi or nigiri, smashing pumpkins roll, Victoria secret roll, beasty bacon roll (don't hate till you try it), ozzy roll. And you know way too many Sapporo and sake for our own good. 

Ok I think that's enough..ugh so good.
author: Justin W.

description: Love it! Decent prices, good service and creative rolls that SF residents are craving. There are enough really good traditional sushi spots in the city, we need more think-outside-the-box sushi places! Ordered the chili garlic edamame, very good. Lots of garlic and just the right amount of chili. Cajun shrimp roll- pretty much a shrimp tempura roll with spicy mayo. Simple but tasty and cheap. Hamachi Lime roll- hamachi, lime, jalapeño, cucumber, CILANTRO. I love cilantro in my sushi rolls so I am now in love with Hot Zushi. I'll be back. Fo sho.
author: Stephanie W.

description: This is or favorite go-to sushi restaurant. Don't let the outside or branding fool you, the fish is extremely fresh and amazing portions. The couple that run the restaurant are super generous and nice and always give us a free "starter" as we're regulars. Definitely give it a try!!!
author: Yvette P.

description:
Okay, their name made me question the quality, but I'm so glad I tried it anyways. Their fish is so fresh & such a great price. This spot is such a little gem!

They have large sake (my fav) for $6, & only $3 for happy hour! HH is from 5:30pm-7pm & they also have various $3 hand rolls.  was really surprised about their rock & roll...I'm not much of an eel fan because I haven't had much great eel in my life other than in Japan. I decided to try it b/c it was on their happy hour list, & I'm so glad I did here. Gotta say, I'll probably come back next week just for their eel (& sake). Their jalapeño tuna is delicious for quality, but I prefer their spicy tuna roll for the spice.  

They have wifi if you ask and sport games on constantly. Also, their customer service is incredible! Any time I take two sips of my water, they're there to fill 'er up!
author: Michelle N.

description: Super yummy, friendly service with great vegetarian and vegan options at affordable prices. The place is warm and has a lovely vibe. I am glad it's an option in my 'hood!
author: Brian K.

description: Place was really good. We walked in during early happy hour and ordered 4 sushi rolls which were really good minus the tuna roll. Wasn't a fan of it it was pretty much canned tuna. The rolls were 3 bucks and Sapporo beers were 3 dollars as well. The atmosphere was nice and relaxing and service was great! Staff was very attentive.
author: Johnny B.

description:
First timer! My boyfriend and I ordered the tuna poke, butterfish nachos, sake nigiri, and tres amigos roll based on all the Yelp reviews.

Tuna poke: delicious and had more tuna than mango or avocado, which we were impressed/happy about! The fried wonton chips they used were perfectly crunchy and the best complement to the poke. Great dish.

Butterfish nachos: comes out with 5 fried wonton chips with a delicious mix of mango, tuna, jalepeno, and something else (can't remember off the top of my head) on top of each chip. Downside was we couldn't share them evenly but big upside was that it was SO good!

Sake nigiri: mouth is watering right now thinking about it - it's by far my favorite nigiri and choice at any sushi restaurant, and Hot Zushi's was no exception. They bring it out with sauce brushed on it and request that we eat it without soy sauce - big plus as it is not common to do, so I really appreciated that! It was the perfect mix of flavor and texture. Mmm.

Tres amigos: first thing we noticed was that the presentation was not great - it was basically falling apart on the dish it came out on. However, it was such a wonderful mix of flavors and ingredients that we got over that reallll quick. Eel, avocado, tuna, cucumber, and yellowtail combined to make a delicious roll!

Service was top notch - free hot green tea and a super sweet server who, and I quote my boyfriend, "said thank you more than any server I've ever had"!

Will definitely come back (:
author: Mio W.

description: This place is the best sushi in the Lower Haight or Hayes Valley areas. The chili garlic edamame alone is reason to come here, but everything here is delicious and the prices are really good.
author: Robin O.

description: This is a hidden gem. I know eventually it will become so popular that they will raise their prices, but in the meantime I will continue to enjoy.
author: David C.

description: Hot Zushi is a hidden gem. The service is incredible, especially given the price. There's usually no wait. It's not the best sushi house I've been to, but they have plenty of awesome options and the prices are right. Their crab hand rolls and chili garlic edamame are amazing. This is our goto sushi place.
author: Steven P.

description: In a world gone mad with 5 dollar coffee, twenty dollar burgers, and an executive branch more Kardashian than Presidential, you can come to Hot Zushi to find some sanity.  Great fresh fish?  Traditional and more creative dishes?  Beyond affordable prices?  A killer happy hour?  Friendly chefs and staff?  They are all to be found at this wonderful little sushi restaurant in the Lower Haight.  It is probably the best sushi deal in the city, but also some of the best sushi in the city.  We come here at least once a week for dinner.  Pro Tip: They have a TV with all the Giants games on.
author: Blake W.

description: Great value for money. My favorate dish is sake toro sashimi (fatty salmon) which is only 13$ for 5 pieces. And the service is superb. The waiters are so nice.
author: Adelle G.

description: Great, fresh sushi for a reasonable price and never too crowded (although I have no idea why). I actually liked their classic rolls the best, as it highlights the fish quite well. Why this place isn't more popular I can't explain!
author: Juliet Y.

description:
Kind of surprised that this place has gotten such great ratings so far! I went here tonight with my friend based on the rave reviews we saw on Yelp, and I really thought the service was great, but the food we had wasn't anything special. I thought it was really nice that they started us off with some carpaccio though!

Tuna Poke: Probably the best thing we had out of all the things we ordered. Mango, avocado, and tuna came with fried gyoza wrappers, which I thought was a great Asian touch to the dish instead of just using tortilla chips.
Butterfish Nachos: This was the thing everyone was raving about, but the tuna poke was way better. This dish was basically tuna poke, but with different fish. It was topped with some kind of mango mix and was hard to eat. One bite and the "nacho" fell apart in our hands immediately (fish was a little hard to bite through).
Big Poppa: We were intrigued by this because it sounded pretty good, but the spicy tuna taste was basically unnoticeable. Out of all the ingredients making up this roll, for some reason, the asparagus stood out the most, but not in a great away. Overall, not too much flavor in this one.
Crunchy Wasabi: Not very memorable even though I just ate it a few hours ago. Again, I felt like it could have been more flavorful and was just missing something.

If you're a big sushi fan, I'm not sure if this would be the place for you! The service was great, it was super clean, and I liked the intimate feel of the space itself. We only had a few things from the menu so maybe there are some knockout dishes we missed, but, overall, I wasn't too wowed by this place.
author: Grace C.

description:
I was drinking at a bar with friends across the street and we decided to get some fresh food instead of bar food. I usually use  Yelp for quick recommendations on what to order and was surprised to find this place wasn't listed. They have a TV in the main area and sushi bar for watching sports. There's also a more private area on the left for a table for two and four.

All the sashimi was very fresh and there were a lot of unique rolls that were created by the sushi chef. My favorite were the Butterfish Nachos and the Delicious Roll. Every tasted great and service was fast. Give this place a try! I'll be coming back!
author: Christopher Y.

description:
This place is awesome - my new go to spot in the city. Very well priced for what you get and the service is impeccable! 

My personal favorites are the tuna tataki and the Toro 4 ways. The best bang for your buck sushi place in the city!
author: Allen W.

description:
I rarely take time to write a review, but this place really deserves one.
It's by far best sushi place I've been in the last five years.

It's far above expectations for a place in this price range.

I'll start with the fact that it's great value for price, 5 star for that. Looking at the check was a pleasant surprise. 4 special rolls, 2 nigiri, 1 baked crab hand roll, 2 miso soup, a large beer and ice creams - all came out to $77, but based on the amount of food and quality, I intuitively expected some $120.

5 star for ambiance. It's a nicely decorated cozy quiet place, totally not crowded even on Friday night. No loud music. Without the TV could've been just perfect, but with it it's still very very good.

Service above expectations as well. The staff really cared. It's hard to explain, myriad of little things that builds an impression. Our hot green tea and water was refilled without asking, we got nice explanations of different meals and options, everything was served in timely and in a nice sequence. No one came up with annoying stupid questions like "are you doing fine" that would usually come in the middle of conversation, yet, at the same time, the staff was always available should we need something.

5 star for food quality and portion size. Baked crab hand roll was a new thing I haven't tried before, it's delicious. The fish was fresh. Commonly known rolls were slightly different from what's served at other places, but I think they were better. Larger, fresher, tastier.

Will definitely come back when I feel like having sushi in SF.
Caveat: it's hard to find a parking spot around that place, but we managed to find street parking a couple of blocks away. I guess I'll use Uber or public transportation next time.
author: Dmitry K.

description:
0Fabulous happy hour yummy yummy I got love in my tummy and I feel like lovin you..

This awesome joint just a blink away from the Haight St. Deli (vegan sandwich paradise) is a great sushi option I stumbled upon...

$3 hand rolls happening at happy hour!
The salmon so fresh, avocado perfect. 
Salmon skin roll was delightful. 
Highly recommended. ..
author: Jimmy F.

description:
So happy this place opened on Haight. 

It's quality fish served by some of the nicest people. Can't ask for more in a neighborhood sushi joint - will be coming here for my weekly sushi fix for the foreseeable future. 

Don't miss the miso soup, pork gyoza, and fresh Nigiri!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Had dinner and drinks at their bar last night and were impressed by the friendliness of the staff. We were the last to leave before they closed and everybody was so nice and didn't rush us out at all.  Definitely a great place to have some good sake and enjoy the company of your friends.
author: Patricia O.

description:
We were looking for a place to get Sake and some apps and ended up staying for 3 hours, due to our fabulous server Connie and the amazing chef who kept making us taste and try new creations.  

We were worried that they'd close down because it was so empty, but so happy to hear they're just new!  I've already been back and Connie remembers my name and once again was a sweetheart... Does this make me their first regular?!? ILL TAKE IT!!!
author: CJ T.

description: I've been meaning to write a review for this spot for quite some time, as it has been a weekly or every other week visit for me.  This is an excellent sushi spot to get fresh sushi at a very affordable price.  Obviously, it isn't trying to compete with the more high-end spots in SF (e.g. Ijji), but the quality to price ratio is excellent.  The service is always fast, friendly, and on-point.  I believe it is a husband/wife team that owns and runs the restaurant, which shows in how much care goes into the service.  The only complaint I would have is the sushi rice could use some improvement.  It almost tastes like they don't use rice wine vinegar at all or something.  I won't ding them for this at all, as I am sure it is something that can be improved.  Highly recommend stopping by if you're in the neighborhood!
author: N T.

description: The sushi is very good for the price. It is not absolutely perfect, but it is objectively rather good. The sake sashimi was of good quality, as was the nigiri. The staff is also very kind.
author: Norcloud S.

description: Nice and clean facility, very nice staff and chef. The spicy options need to go a notch up as I honestly thought they forgot to make it spicy. Then I asked for spicy mayo....figured they try to play safe. So, do ask for extra spicy option as I am always looking for a spicy kick
author: Sez Z.

description: I liked it. Affordable and fresh. Super friendly staff.
author: Mark S.

description: I dont eat sushi,but my friends do. Apparently, it's delicious .I always have the beef short ribs with pickled daylong and turnip,avocado pineapple salsa ...meat is thin sliced,bone in ,fire grilled to perfection. Excellent with spicy wok tossed green beans.
author: Christina M.

description: You have to try their bluefin Toro!! It will melt in your mouth.. They have great baked crab roll if you want to find out what a good crab tastes like. I was very pleased with their quality of food and service. By far one of the best sushi experiences I've ever had!
author: Alvin K.

description:
I went here for the cool name of the place, but I stayed for the food.  Nice and intimate place that's great to take a date or a few friends to enjoy good quality Japanese food.  I had the Tiger roll (just enough spice on the crab meat with salmon, scallop and avocado)  and theirs has to be among the top I've had around these parts.  Also had the Butterfish Nachos, and I think it was the pineapple salsa and the butterfish that really make this dish. Highly recommend it.

Parking can be hard to come-by since the area is frequented by a lot of bar hoppers and coffee drinkers nearby.  Suggest other alternate modes of transportation.
author: Chan L.

description: This, by far, my favorite sushi place in the City.  Their Happy Hour is almost embarrassingly cheap.  And the name is not a misnomer, as they make a great hot crab roll and tuna (with the head on), which is how I like it.  Anyone who gave this place less than five stars is completely off their rocker.
author: Joe E.

description:
Went here for dinner with bf since we were around the area. It is a cute little sushi place with pretty good food at a reasonable price. The waiter is attentive to our service. Call ahead if you have a party more than 4 as the place is small. They have a little cave in area for more privacy. They sell wine, beer and sake.

 Tuna poke: fish is fresh and it comes with avocado, mango and nacho chips to hold it. The mango adds some sweetness into the dish.

 Butterfish nachos: Comes in 5. It is served on top of a nacho chips with guacamole, butterfish with a slice of jalapeno. 

Crunchy shrimp: it is a interesting dish. Practically like a shrimp tempura roll but the tempura is coated with cajun seasoning.  

Hot sake: they only have large size and it is pretty HOT when it come. Be careful not to burn your finger. 

Hamachi kama: the fish collar they gave was pretty big. It has alot of meat but not overcook. Good job on this dish. 

Three Amigos: it has avocado, eel and something else in it. I forgot the last ingredient. It was pretty good as well. 

Overall, if you are around the area. You should come by to try this new place.
author: Siri L.

description: Very very good sushi. Price is not bad.  Very good proportion and the service was excellent!  Very nice restaurant too.
author: Marie Erika E.

description:
Tuna poke was one of the highlights from a medley of negiri, rolls, and sake. Everything tasted amazing and the service fast and friendly. 

Do yourself a favor and order any of dishes with the deep fried chips - buttery with so much flavor and texture. I would definitely eat here again.
author: Tony B.

description: This place has really changed improved since they opened up. Great fish with a rotating set if specials.
author: Antoine W.

description: Came in here randomly and loved it!! Order the hot stuff, it's amazing!! Great to have a good sushi place close to home!
author: Alejandro C.

description:
I was a little nervous that Hot Zushi only had one Yelp review. Turns out they just opened last week! I was in the mood for some pretty simple rolls, which were great. The fish was fresh and the rolls are really reasonably priced. The staff was also super friendly and thoughtful in checking menu items for my food allergy. So, I felt compelled to write a review, even though I've always been a passive Yelper (I think this is my first review!).

Glad that this place opened up and looking forward to coming back soon and trying some of their specialty rolls.
author: Katie B.

description:
First off let me say that I go to sushi restaurants at least once/twice a week. I was in SF for work and just happened to swing by this place and its hands down the best sushi I have had in a long time. 

The sushi chef, David, is the man! He gave out free tasters while I he was making plates for customers. He genuinely knows what he is doing. Absolutely fresh and cheap prices. No where in LA or SF beats this place. Truly a little gem. You won't be disappointed! 

Ps. - order the butterfish nachos. By far some amazing Asian/American fusion sushi dish to enjoy as an appetizer.
author: Amir M.

description: One of my new favorite sushi spots in SF! The sushi was amazing. Delicious and huge portions. The miso soup was one of the best I've ever had (I didn't think that was possible). And the service was perfect. Great food and kind people...yes please!
author: Cynthia C.

description: This is one of my favorite sushi places in the city! My fiancé and I go all the time!!! The owner is so sweet. They also have the best spicy mayo I've ever had.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I almost never leave reviews but had to make an exception here. Hot Zushi is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant. It's across the street from another sushi place, and there are probably 4+ others within walking distance. So what makes this place great, I hear you asking. 

Well. The food is exceptional. I always get the nigiri tasting (8 fat, beautifully constructed pieces on perfect rice for $18? what year is it??) and it always blows me away. David knows what he's doing at that sushi counter.

The price is unbelievable. Two hideously expensive sushi places opened up less than a month apart from each other close by and Hot Zushi blows them out of the water at like 1/2 or maybe 1/4 the price.

Service is always extremely attentive and quick but the food, man, the food.

Somewhat funny name, amazing sushi. You owe it to yourself to check this place out.
author: Seth G.

description: Undoubtedly the best sushi in the city. Friendly staff, unbounded menu, simply great rolls. Daily happy hour is hard to beat. Recommend the dragon roll and the $3 happy hour large Sapporo for a pleasant and return-worthy eating experience.
author: Stephanie S.

description: My son announced that this is his new favorite Sushi spot. The food was very good and reasonably priced. When we are back in town we will definitely stop by again.
author: J K.

description: Great service and there wasn't a line on a Friday night for dinner. Both huge pluses for me. The food wasn't mind-blowing but it satisfied our cravings for sushi at reasonable prices. This isn't a place for top-tier omakase sushi joint, but a neighborhood sushi spot that fills you up without breaking the bank.
author: Derrick W.

description: Amazing taste and very nice people. Sashimi mix and sake avocado roll were  amazing. Highly recommended!!
author: Seniha K.

description: The sushi, sake, & service here are all stellar!   Can't wait to come back for more happy hours (every day of the week!)
author: June H.

description: We live in the hood so checked this place out. Was surprised how good it was. And they were super nice (we went early and brought our baby). They brought over a sashimi on the house that was marinated in something delicious- was amazing. Really good sushi. Hope it does well.
author: justen e.

description: This is by far the best sushi in the neighborhood and my favorite one in SF. Everything I've had here has been amazing and the staff is super friendly!
author: sara m.

description: Great, fresh, not overpriced sushi. Sashimi platter  was decent. Special rolls were mainly fish rather than rice, the way they are at Sushi Raw next door. Prices a bit more reasonable than Nara across the street. Miso soup was not oversalted and flavorful! Very candid, humble owners, loved them! So excited to have discovered this new sushi joint!
author: Oxana K.

description: Excellent sushi and service at a reasonable price. We came in on a Monday night and had quick service. All of our dishes from edamame to the kamakazi role were very good. I've been to several sushi places in SF and this was well above par.
author: Kyle W.

description: I can't even begin to say how delicious this place is or how amazing the service.  We are so happy we literally stumbled across this place.  The butterfish nachos are insane, and that is just the beginning.  We wish many happy years to this restaurant!!!  Thanks for adding a special touch to our honeymoon.
author: Amanda H.

description: The ramen was amazing and a good price. Nice portions too. Lisa is very friendly next to the fountain in the corner. My dog could see me the whole time all around perfect date with Karen.
author: Zelda S.

description: Its damn good fish for the prices, especially for sushi in SF.  But some rolls were pretty sloppy and falling apart and food came out in weird sequence with not much attention to who had ordered what.  The nachos are over-rated and too sweet, but everything else was delish.
author: Ian I.

description: I was bummed when Raijin Sushi (who previously occupied this space) shut down unexpectedly in December, because I had always thought it was good quality for the price. Then I tried Hot Zushi. Not only is the sushi here fresh and reasonably priced, but the staff is genuinely friendly and super attentive. Try the Smashing Pumpkin roll with tempura pumpkin. Great low-key spot for weeknight dinner or takeout.
author: Anna G.

description: This was such a good choice for our first night in San Fran. A bit nervous as we were the only customers when we went in. The staff was very friendly & attentive. We ordered a bunch of different rolls and all of them were fabulous. I know it sounds weird, but the bacon one was to die for! You must try it.
author: Brenda V.

description:
Super good and very good prices! Loved it!!!!!!!!
I would recommend for any sushi lovers.
author: Isaac L.

description: Great place to grab a bite and watch the game! I sat at the counter and the sushi chef gave me a free treat. It was quick, fresh, affordable, and there are TVs over the bar and in the main seating area.
author: Audrey B.

description: My new favorite sushi place  !!!! So goooood!!! I live nearby so I'll be coming here very often
author: Eddie L.

description:
I rarely post about restaurants but this one is a new one on the crowded Haight street.

The restaurant looks a bit unassuming from the outside and we almost skipped it. I'm glad we didn't. It just opened a week ago and the food is great!

Generous portions, fun specialty rolls, and the fish tastes great. I loved the Tuna Tataki. Server and Owners also very friendly. We will be back again.
author: Jay W.

description: A good new addition to the neighborhood. The servers are friendly and attentive and the menu includes a number of tasty but light options. Try the big crab hand roll!
author: Andrew H.

description: Awesome addition to the neighborhood! Friendliest service and everything I had was delicious. I ordered the flying kamikaze, and they brought out a crab hand roll that was to die for!! Super affordable too!
author: Krista N.

description:
Cheap and cheerful!The staff are so nice always welcoming when you walk through the door.
Good menu and great brussel sprouts.
author: Joan D.

description: Came here with the fiancé on a Saturday night. Waited 20 minutes to get our order in - 2 small dishes, 2 nigiri sushi. Took another 20 minutes to get the food. The food was overall mediocre. They need more than one waiter working the restaurant. I will not be back.
author: Johnny C.

description: The food was fantastic - delicious rolls, everything tasted really fresh, decent prices. But the wait time was just ridiculous. We were a party of 6 on a Sunday night and they were so busy that they could only bring out 1-2 items at a time at 10 minute intervals. It took about an hour for everyone to get their food!  Once it did arrive though, it was good enough that I would try it again, though maybe for takeout next time.
author: Mallika M.

description: Delicious and way less expensive than all other sushi restaurants out there. The service is great and the sushi is fresh and delicious.. What else could you ask for?
author: Anonymous P.

description: Wow what a restaurant! The sashimi was thick, tender and flavorful. The rolls were creative and luxurious. They served beer too.
author: Mike S.

description: Amazing neighborhood joint. Super low key. Super delicious. Particularly recommend the "Tempura Jagger". Also, everything's usually pretty speedy.
author: Ari K.

description: Came here to get some sushi rolls. Turns out they just opened a weeks ago. I just love their unique rolls they have and the sashimi was fresh and sooo gooood. I also tried their butterfish nachos and was amazing. I will definitely be back soon!
author: Ben Y.

description: My favorite neighborhood spot by far. The people there are so great, make me feel at home every time. And good thing the food is delicious too! I usually go for the classics, they have great fish, and also some interesting looking special rolls too. If youre gonna get sushi in the area definitely come here!
author: Max M.

description: I really like this place.  The most common place I go for sushi now,  the staff are so nice,  feel like my friends now,  the menu has all the classic options,  and some pretty interesting special rolls too.  And not to expensive!! Go here and say hi to them for me.  Get some yellow tail and scallop
author: Eric T.

description: great sushi! i had 3 rolls and loved them all! The portions were large and the prices were great. The fish quality is very fresh and all the employees are very happy and friendly. this is my new favorite spot!!!
author: Mike F.

description: We've been waiting to see what would become of this location given all the turnover. It's always a little perplexing what kind of restaurants people decide to open, ie a sushi place across the street from Nara, etc.  It's actually quite nice - the string beans appetizer was very tasty, the sushi was made with care and good ingredients, the rice was of a good consistency and temperature and everything was presented attractively. Also a nice and interesting selection of vegetarian rolls.  I like the food I had there better than, say, Sushi Raw down the street. The physical space is still a little sad-looking, same as it was before, though I can't really place why. The lighting is definitely a part of it, just like at Raijin.
author: queue q.
